intro: Gilia filifolia, commonly known as the threadleaf gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, thread-like leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Gilia filifolia typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands or along streambanks. It is an important nectar source for various pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
